home.whyElJemText: Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1979, the Amphitheatre of El Jem is one of the best-preserved Roman stone ruins in the world. Its exceptional acoustics and majestic architecture create an unparalleled setting for symphonic music, where every note resonates through 2,000 years of history.

event.title: Event Details
event.entryRulesText: Gates open 1 hour before the performance. Late arrivals will be seated during the first suitable break. No re-entry after exiting the venue.
event.seatingInfoText: Seating is assigned by zone. Within each zone, seating is on a first-come, first-served basis. Cushions are provided for stone seating areas.
event.faqDressAnswer: Smart casual is recommended. Evenings can be cool, so a light jacket is advised.
event.faqParkingAnswer: Free parking is available within a 5-minute walk of the amphitheatre.
event.faqAccessibilityAnswer: Accessible seating is available. Please contact support when booking for assistance.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about the festival

items.q: When does the festival take place?
items.a: The festival typically runs from July to August each year. Check our program page for exact dates.

items.q: Can I get a refund on my tickets?
items.a: Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable. Please review your selection carefully before purchasing.
Gates open 1 hour before each performance begins.
Smart casual is recommended. Evenings can be cool, so bring a light jacket.
Free parking is available within a 5-minute walk of the amphitheatre.

items.q: Can I bring food or drinks?
items.a: Outside food and beverages are not permitted. Refreshments are available inside the venue.
Yes, accessible seating is available. Please contact support when booking for assistance.

items.q: How do I get my tickets?
items.a: Tickets are digital. You can download them as PDF or show the QR code from your account.
